Content-Type: text/plain; charset="UTF-8"

*apologies for cross-postings.  4 weeks left to submit *



*Virtual Creatures Competition*
https://www.cs.utexas.edu/~joel/virtual_creatures_contest2016/submit/

to be held as part of the

2016 Genetic and Evolutionary Computation Conference (GECCO-2016)

July 20-24 2016, Denver, Colorado, USA  http://gecco-2016.sigevo.org/
<http://www.sigevo.org/gecco-2013/>

Submission Deadline for this competition is *June 12, 2016*

The third annual Virtual Creatures Competition at the Genetic and
Evolutionary Computation Conference showcases the power, beauty, and
creativity of evolutionary computation through virtual creatures with
evolved morphologies and controllers.  The goal of this competition is to
create an archive of recent achievements in the evolution of embodied
agents in virtual creatures/evolutionary robotics.

== Entry Submission ==

Entrants must submit: (1) a video of up to 5 minutes that demonstrates an
evolved virtual creature (or many such creatures) engaging in interesting
adaptive behavior, and (2) a brief paper (no more than 2 pages) describing
the video and the underlying evolutionary algorithm and innovation of the
approach. All submissions should be sent to nac93@... or jleh@...
by June 12, 2016.  Please note that *attending the conference is not
required to submit an entry*.

== Evaluation ==

The submissions will be peer-reviewed by prominent researchers from the
evolutionary computation and artificial life communities. Each submission
will be judged on the following criteria:  perceptual animacy (perceived
aliveness), technical achievement, aesthetic appeal, and innovation.

== Presentation ==

Finalists selected by the jury will be invited to present their submission
at the competition session, held during the GECCO conference. The winner of
the competition will be announced at the SIGEVO meeting ceremony, on July
24, 2016.

== Organizers ==

Nick Cheney <http://ncheney.com>, Cornell University, USA

Joel Lehman <http://joellehman.com>, IT University of Copenhagen, Denmark

== Reviewers ==

Thomas Ray <http://life.ou.edu/> (University of Oklahoma, USA)

Peter Bentley <http://about.peterjbentley.com/> (University College London,
UK)

Auke Jan Ijspeert <http://biorob.epfl.ch/people/ijspeert> (EPFL,
Switzerland)

Ken Stanley <http://www.cs.ucf.edu/%7Ekstanley/> (University of Central
Florida, USA)

Larry Yeager <http://www.shinyverse.org/larryy/> (Google; Indiana
University, USA)

== Important Dates ==

* Submission deadline: June 12, 2016

* Conference: July 20-24, 2016


Thank you, and we look forward to your submissions!

Best,
Nick Cheney and Joel Lehman
https://www.cs.utexas.edu/~joel/virtual_creatures_contest2016/index.html

--001a114491be12c86d0533096dd8
